pullRequest.body:
This enables proofs like
```lean
unseal Nat.sqrt.iter in
example : Irrational √24 := by decide
```

This also deprecates the old `irrational_sqrt_rat_iff` in favor of the new `irrational_sqrt_ratCast_iff`, which is better-named and -stated.

[Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Why.20is.20proof.20the.20root.202.20is.20irrational.20so.20long.3F/near/444315500) motivation.

---

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

Should the lemmas be `simp`?

### PR summary [8b8338dcf4](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13867/commits/8b8338dcf4f8a811bc03ba23f0baface05f6326c)

#### Import changes

No significant changes to the import graph

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ instance (n : ℕ) : Decidable (Irrational (√n))`
`+ instance (z : ℤ) : Decidable (Irrational (√z))`
`+ instance {n : ℕ} [n.AtLeastTwo] : Decidable (Irrational (√(no_index (OfNat.ofNat n))))`
`+ irrational_sqrt_intCast_iff`
`+ irrational_sqrt_intCast_iff_of_nonneg`
`+ irrational_sqrt_natCast_iff`
`+ irrational_sqrt_ofNat_iff`
`+ irrational_sqrt_ratCast_iff`
`+ irrational_sqrt_ratCast_iff_of_nonneg`
`+ ne_ofNat`
`+ not_irrational_ofNat`
`+ not_irrational_one`
`+ not_irrational_zero`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>
Should these be `simp` lemmas?

> Should these be `simp` lemmas?

My default is to be cautious; do you feel strongly?

LGTM!
maintainer merge
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by MichaelStollBayreuth.

Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9562066621/job/26357659591)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9562066621/job/26357659842)
See `{Nat|Int|Rat}.not_irrational`.
Removed these for now; though I think the names should be changed / deprecated in a later PR
Should the comment referring to the note on `no_index` be added here as well?

[Irrational.ne_zero](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Real/Irrational.html#Irrational.ne_zero), [Irrational.ne_one](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Real/Irrational.html#Irrational.ne_one) are very close, but I think the statements here do make sense as `simp` lemmas.
This file could do with further cleanup to put these things nearer each other, but I don't want to scope creep too far.

```suggestion
  rw [← Rat.isSquare_natCast_iff, ← irrational_sqrt_ratCast_iff_of_nonneg n.cast_nonneg,
```

```suggestion
  rw [ne_eq, ← Rat.exists_mul_self]
  obtain hq | hq := le_or_lt 0 q
  · simp_rw [irrational_sqrt_ratCast_iff_of_nonneg hq, ← @eq_comm _ q]
    exact (and_iff_left hq).symm
  · rw [sqrt_eq_zero_of_nonpos (mod_cast hq.le)]
```
Thanks! I ended up deprecating this lemma in favor of one spelt with `IsSquare`.

```suggestion
theorem irrational_sqrt_two : Irrational (√2) :=
  Nat.prime_two.irrational_sqrt
```
While we are at it...
This one feels a bit out of scope; also, it's in some sense defeq abuse of `Nat.cast` on reals.
OK.
Maybe mention this in the module docstring, too? (In particular the `unseal` part, as this is not at all obvious...)
Done.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: `Irrational √q` iff `¬IsSquare q` for `Nat`/`Int`/`Rat`
